block.p: Kenny Anderson scored 32 points and the United States, which squandered most of a 22-point second half lead, held off Argentina, 104-100, last night in the quarterfinal round of the World Basketball Championships in Buenos Aires. The United States, which went 3-0 in the qualifying round, will face Australia on Tuesday as quarterfinal-round play continues.

Kenny Anderson scored 32 points and the United States, which squandered most of a 22-point second half lead, held off Argentina, 104-100, last night in the quarterfinal round of the World Basketball Championships in Buenos Aires. The United States, which went 3-0 in the qualifying round, will face Australia on Tuesday as quarterfinal-round play continues.

Kenny Anderson scored 32 points and the United States, which squandered most of a 22-point second half lead, held off Argentina, 104-100, last night in the quarterfinal round of the World Basketball Championships in Buenos Aires. The United States, which went 3-0 in the qualifying round, will face Australia on Tuesday as quarterfinal-round play continues. The top two teams from each four-team group advance to Friday's semifinals. (AP)

Soviet Union 75, Greece, 57: Aleksandr Volkov keyed a 15-0 run midway through the second half and the Soviet Union beat Greece. Two free throws by Pano Giannakis with 10 minutes 4 seconds to play brought Greece to 51-49 before the Soviet team put away the game with the decisive run, taking a 66-49 lead with 4:14 to play. (AP)

Yugoslavia 105, Brazil 86: Yugoslavia's connection with the National Basketball Association scored 80 points yesterday in a 105-86 victory over Brazil in the world championships. Yugoslavia led, 52-41, at halftime and stretched to its biggest lead with a 25-12 run over the first eight minutes of the second half. Yugoslavia led, 62-48, when Drazen Petrovic of the Portland Trail Blazers, the N.B.A.'s second-leading 3-point shooter last season, hit four 3-pointers in a 12-3 run. He finished with 27 points.

Karel Novacek of Czechoslovakia was the first seeded player to be eliminated at the United States Men's Hardcourt Championships in Indianapolis yesterday. The 10th-seeded Novacek retired because of a stomach illness after falling behind Thierry Champion of France, 6-2, 3-1.
